snippet: A new film, almost six hours long, and a body of sculpture inspired by the film are being exhibited at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles.
abstract: Artist Matthew Barney's six-hour film River of Fundament, his most ambitious undertaking since Cremaster cycle movies in mid-1990s, is inspired by Norman Mailer's 1983 novel Ancient Evenings; movie and related exhibit of Barney's sculptures are on display at Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art.
lead_paragraph: A new film, almost six hours long, and a body of sculpture inspired by the film are being exhibited at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles.

headline.main: Matthew Barney’s Most Punishing Tour: ‘River of Fundament’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art
